verses.roman:
yathābudho jalaṁ hitvā
praticchannaṁ tad-udbhavaiḥ
abhyeti mṛga-tṛṣṇāṁ vai
tadvat tvāhaṁ parāṅ-mukhaḥ

synonyms: yathā—as; abudhaḥ—someone who is unintelligent; jalam—water; hitvā—overlooking; praticchannam—covered; tat-udbhavaiḥ—by the plants growing in it; abhyeti—approaches; mṛga-tṛṣṇām—a mirage; vai—indeed; tadvat—in that same way; tvā—You; aham—I; parāk-mukhaḥ—turned away.
translation: Just as a fool overlooks a body of water covered by the vegetation growing in it and chases a mirage, so I have turned away from You.
